DataElement.preferredName: Received Therapy Protocol Contraindicated Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to treatment contraindicated by the protocol received.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to treatment contraindicated by the protocol received.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:To indicate the inadvisability of (a medical treatment, for example). (Dictionary.com)

Concepts.definition: A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
State of a particular method of treatment, regimen, procedure, medication, etc. of being unsuitable and inadvisable, often because of a likely adverse reaction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did patient receive treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive treatment for this previous malignancy that would contraindicate this protocol therapy?
